Notes: Vulnerability in the implementation of the PixarLog encoder. Cannot be directly triggered by a crafted TIFF file. (Unless the application reads the TIFF and writes it somewhere else, e.g tiffcp)
Vulnerability in TIFFFlushData1 error code path, which fails to reset the tif_rawcc and tif_rawcp members. Bug in write path. Cannot be triggered by crafted TIFF file.
Bug in write path. Cannot be triggered by crafted TIFF file.
Bug in write path. Cannot be triggered by crafted TIFF file.
Bug in write path. Cannot be directly triggered by crafted TIFF file.
Not a DoS. If a loop exists in the IFD linked list, traversal is terminated after a set threshold (65535) of nodes.
Duplicate of CVE-2016-3658 (not exactly, but very similar bug fix)
Might require a vulnerable application to trigger (where the supplied buffer by the application is too small)
Not a core bug. Similar to CVE-2017-9935
Not a core bug. According to the bug report 2810, probably not even a bug.
Bug report unclear. Seems to have the same fix as that for CVE-2017-11613
Bug report unclear. Seems to have the same fix as that for CVE-2017-11613
An assertion was placed where an error should have been handled instead, causing a denial of service. Not interesting.
Not a core bug. Bug report unclear as to the source of the culprit.
